title: The Project's Carrie Bickmore shares photo with Sex And The City's Sarah Jessica Parker
text:
Sarah Jessica Parker was an in-studio guest on The Project on Monday night.

And after the interview, host Carrie Bickmore was eager to share a photo of herself with the Sex and the City star to Instagram.

But she subtly threw shade at her colleagues by cropping them out of the snap so only herself and Carrie were in the frame.

Scroll down for video

'This crop is hurtful': The Project's Carrie Bickmore cropped her co-stars out of a photo with Sex and the City's Sarah Jessica Parker - and they weren't impressed

'ONE CARRIE is never enough! I have cropped everyone else out...' she captioned the post, referencing Sarah's role as Carrie Bradshaw in Sex and the City.

'SJP looking longingly at me (or past me, I am not 100 percent sure) will be my new screen saver,' she added.

But while Carrie was happy with the photo, her co-hosts were less than pleased about being cropped out.

Ouch! 'This crop is hurtful,' comedian Tommy Little (pictured) joked in the comments section

'This crop is hurtful,' comedian Tommy Little joked in the comments section.

In the original, uncropped photo, Tommy was visible in the frame alongside colleagues Hamish MacDonald and Jane Hall.

In Carrie's Instagram post, she also referenced Sarah's previous appearance on The Project in 2011.

Remember this? In Carrie's Instagram post, she also referenced Sarah's previous appearance on The Project in 2011 (pictured)

During her last visit, Sarah complimented The Project's panel, which at the time consisted of Carrie, Dave Hughes, Charlie Pickering and Meshel Laurie.

'What I’m most impressed about is that you’re able to cover such a diverse range of topics in such a short time, and it’s so smart and interesting and clever, and you all are such an interesting quartet,' she said on the show.

Sarah joked about wanting to rip off the format and create a 'dumbed down' version for American audiences.
description: Sarah Jessica Parker was an in-studio guest on The Project on Monday night.
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
